intro: Caiophora heptamera, commonly known as the seven-branched caiophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive branched inflorescence. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its unique structure and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
